definitions.definition: a particular situation or example of something:
examples: Over a hundred people were injured, in several cases seriously.
There's no coffee left? In that case I'll have tea.
If that is the case then I will be very disappointed.
I don't want to go and in any case, I haven't been invited.

definitions.definition: because of a possibility of something happening, being needed, etc.:
examples: I don't think I'll need any money but I'll bring some just in case.

definitions.definition: in connection with someone or something, or in the situation of something:
examples: The law will apply equally to men and women except in the case of maternity leave.

definitions.definition: used when a situation is of a particular type:
examples: She doesn't want to work full-time, it's a case of having to.

definitions.definition: an example that shows that what you are saying is true or helps to explain why you are saying it:
examples: Lack of communication causes serious problems and their marriage is a case in point.

definitions.definition: one of the stated possibilities that is true:
examples: When the election is called in April, or June, as the case might be, we shall be ready for it.
